The &tool; allows you to share folders to other computers in your network or in the internet.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &tool; allows you to share folders to other computers in your network or in the internet.

sect1.title: Getting started
sect1.para: You can start &tool; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Press the right mouse button on any local folder and choose Share folder to share or stop sharing the folder.

sect1.para: When you start &tool;, you will be prompted for the administrator password, this is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the following window is displayed.
The &tool; main window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: This allows you to specify which folders are going to be shared through the network.
Specifies global settings for a group of shared folders.

sect2.title: To share a folder
sect2.para: There are 3 ways of sharing a folder:

listitem.para: In the Shared Folders tab press the Add button. In the Share Folders dialog fill in the folder you wish to share.
Right click on a local folder and select the option Share folder.
Drag a folder and drop it in the shared folders list in the main window.

sect2.title: To stop sharing a folder
sect2.para: There are 2 ways to stop sharing a folder:

listitem.para: In the Shared Folders tab select the folder you want to stop sharing and press the Delete button.
Right click on a local folder and select the option Share folder, then select not to share in the Share through combobox.

sect2.title: To modify a folder sharing properties
sect2.para: In the Shared Folders tab select the folder you want to modify and press the Properties button.

sect2.title: To modify global sharing properties
sect2.para: In the General Properties tab modify any of the values.
